Tucson still was not about to give up.  They had him all right, but he wasn=
't about to just throw in the towel.  This made him extremely angry and whe=
n he was just an Autobot, anger would often power his all wheel drive syste=
m to do things far beyond his normal capabilities.  

" You think you have =
power over my comrades and myself, right now it looks that way, but there i=
s one thing we have that you will never have, and never will be able to att=
ain.  A power that only we know how to use, and a power that comes from wit=
hin.  It's a force that even overshadows your own yet a power that is so si=
mple that even the most sentient of beings are capable of using it.  You ha=
ve greed and greed is power, but nothing can ever overshadow the power that=
 comes from true compassion, caring, and love.   Yes, LOVE.  You are not ca=
pable of this power and never will be.  It's true as the old saying goes...=
 LOVE CONQOURS ALL!"

Carefully, in Vehicle form, Tucson is still stationar=
y, yet his front hood begins to glow and pulsate even brighter than before.=
  In this realm he could not transform, yet, in the other realm he was alre=
ady transformed. He uses an indoor port to hook himself up to Vestige, shar=
ing with him his power.  The power that pulsates from his heart and not fro=
m the power of the Matrix.

" Our hearts are all but the same Vestige, we m=
ust combine our compassions for each other, and project it toward others wh=
o also have the ability to reach deep down in their hearts.  Only then can =
we save Rodimus from the grip of these demonic creatures." 

--- In nbwrpg@=
yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

so than he was used to. He was determined to get through the crisis and fin=
d Rodimus. His heart had shown him the way, and there was nothing anyone co=
uld do to stop him. With Vestige in his cab, he keeps careful watch over hi=
s newly found old friend, and secures him with a saftey belt around his sho=
ulders, to keep him safely in place on his seat.

the ride may get rough, but we will make it."

t, but with Tuscon's help he is securely held

.

> With a burst of power from Tuscon the powerful vehicle rushed foward=
,
> pushing through the rest of the hall and powering through the frame of
=
> the doorway. As Tuscon came into the room he was immediately ensnared
> i=
n what would appear to be vines or perhaps more of those Tendrils
> similar=
 to the ones that had bound Rodimus before all this started.

ed to snake thier way around his vehicular mode to hold

=
> The walls and floor of this room were white, sterile and clean. The
> flo=
or was crafted from some sort of metal as were the walls. In the
> middle o=
f the room a single bed surrounded by all sorts of scanning
> and medical e=
quipment. Three insect creatures were standing over the
> bed. They were ob=
viously of the same race as the spider like creatures
> and the winged ones=
 that had been harrassing Tuscon before, but these
> were in a more humanoi=
d mode, a 'robot' mode if you will. All three of
> them were female, at lea=
st they would appear to be if a human were
> looking on. On the bed a figur=
e lay strapped down, the form blocked
> from view by the figures that stood=
 over it.
> 
> "You are too late Autobot!" One of the three females said, t=
he taller
> of the two in the center. "We have all that we need from this o=
ne, and
> even now your data will fill our banks with data, data that we ca=
n use
> to bring about your destruction."
> 
> The tendrils that were strug=
gling to hold on to Tuscon were begining
> to change not only color to matc=
h Tuscon, but also thier texture and
> shape were modifying as well.
> 
> T=
he larger female stepped away from the bed to walk towards Tuscon,
> "The q=
ueen will want you for herself." The female smiled, "We shall
> see that yo=
u are prepared for her."

ee the figure on the bed,
